message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with fair representation in decision-making bodies, which is a topic that falls under the category of game theory (cs.GT). The use of voting weights and the Penrose square root rule also suggests a connection to algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). The consideration of single-peaked preferences and positive correlation of local voters suggests a connection to social choice theory and computational social science (cs.SI). The use of the Shapley value, a concept from cooperative game theory, suggests a connection to machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.LG, cs.AI).
